content: r11 *single_crochet 9 increase* 22 r12 - r13 single_crochet around 22 r14 fold in half and single_crochet 11 across the top fasten_off do not stuff beak chain 4 using color #3 we will be working around this chain r1 skipping the first chain single_crochet in the next two stitches then place 3sc in the following stitch single_crochet in the next stitch and then place 2 more single_crochet in the same spot as your first stitch 8 r2 *single_crochet 3 increase* x2 slip_stitch to first stitch fasten_off feet make 2 chain 5 using color #3 we will be working around this chain r1 skipping the first chain single_crochet in the next three stitches then place 3sc in the following stitch single_crochet in the next two stitches and then place 2 more single_crochet in the same spot as your first stitch 10 r2 *single_crochet 4 increase* x2 12 r3 - r4 single_crochet around 12 r5 fold in half and single_crochet 12 across the top fasten_off do not stuff assembly ● if you use the sweet snuggles yarn i very highly recommend that you use a similar-color worsted weight yarn for sewing sweet snuggles and lots of plush yarn has a tendency to snap when it gets pulled making it risky for sewing ● sew the top of the head closed ● sew the bottom of the beak between r29 and r30 and the top of the beak through r32 and r33 centered on the middle of the headpatch ● sew each arm at an angle starting where the headpatch and body meet ● sew the back of the feet the 12 single_crochet across the top between r3 and r4 at an angle that follows the curve of the round adding a stitch in the top center of the foot will help keep them from being too floppy circled below enjoy your new birb buddy
